description: five heads in a circle; head in lower right has mouth open with long fangs; frowning face with long nose at bottom center; grimacing balding head in lower left; compacted face in ULC, with head looking up; head with very large chin in profile, URC
medium: Pen and brown ink over traces of black chalk on laid paper
provenance: [R. E. Lewis, San Francisco, until 1969; sold August, for $300, to Moir]; Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1969-d. 2010; bequeathed to MIA)
title: Five Grotesque Heads
